TextString.Name: ChickenDescriptionString
TextString.String: One of the most common kind of meat found in the world.

TextString.Name: ScorpionFishDescriptionString
TextString.String: While incredibly ugly, the Scorpion Fish is widely appreciated for its taste.

TextString.Name: AllspiceDescriptionString
TextString.String: Sometimes people naming stuff are not creative and when they found this spice, smelling an aroma that had hints of several other spices, called it Allspice.

TextString.Name: AlmondsDescriptionString
TextString.String: Almonds are originary of the Middle East but are now appreciated in the whole world

TextString.Name: AnchoviesDescriptionString
TextString.String: Anchovies are small fishes that can be found in most seas and oceans.

TextString.Name: AppleDescriptionString
TextString.String: Apples are fruit that, according to the legends, can banish evil doctors back to their original plan of existence.

TextString.Name: ApricotDescriptionString
TextString.String: Apricots are small and sweet fruits that are often dried.

TextString.Name: ArtichokesDescriptionString
TextString.String: Artichokes are edible flowers. They don't look good, and may also have thorns, but their taste is unique.

TextString.Name: AsparagusDescriptionString
TextString.String: Asparagus is a spring vegetable that spontaneusly grows in nature, leading hordes of asparagus scavengers IN YOUR DAMN GARDEN WHY DON'T YOU GO AWAY YOU ROBBERS?

TextString.Name: AvocadoDescriptionString
TextString.String: Avocados are really trendy now! Yay! Let's spend 20 dollars for an Avocado toast that is literally some Avocado on a toasted slice of Bread! Yay!

TextString.Name: BaconDescriptionString
TextString.String: Bacon, with all its varieties that can be found in several different cultures, is one of the most popular ingredients in the world.

TextString.Name: BananaDescriptionString
TextString.String: Bananas are one of the few fruits that grow with a protective peel that's not a pain in the ass to remove.

TextString.Name: BasilDescriptionString
TextString.String: Basil is a culinary herb with a distinctive flavor.

TextString.Name: BassDescriptionString
TextString.String: The are more than a dozen species to which people refer with the name "Bass", so we just placed one hoping that no one would notice.

TextString.Name: Bay_LeavesDescriptionString
TextString.String: Bay Leaves are aromatic leaves used in cooking, often looted from other people's hedges.

TextString.Name: BeansDescriptionString
TextString.String: There are dozens, if not hundreds, of different kind of Beans, but here you have them as a single ingredient!

TextString.Name: BechamelDescriptionString
TextString.String: Bechamel is a creamy sauce made with butter, flour and milk.

TextString.Name: BeefDescriptionString
TextString.String: Beef is one of the most popular kind of meat, widely appreciated all around the world, with people in every single place thinking they are the best at cooking it.

TextString.Name: BeetDescriptionString
TextString.String: Beets are strange and colored roots that can be eaten, possibly in a salad or something like that.

TextString.Name: BiscuitsDescriptionString
TextString.String: Biscuits are used as ingredient in many dessert recipes.

TextString.Name: BlackPepperDescriptionString
TextString.String: Black Pepper is a widespread spice very common in most cultures.

TextString.Name: BlackTruffleDescriptionString
TextString.String: Truffles are ugly subterrean tubers found by dogs and sold for absurd prices.

TextString.Name: BlondeBeerDescriptionString
TextString.String: Blonde Beer is very common, every single country in the world produces at least one kind of Blonde Beer.

TextString.Name: BlueCheeseDescriptionString
TextString.String: Glory to the man that forgot to eat his cheese and three days later, despite finding it full of molds, still tried to eat it.

TextString.Name: BlueBerriesDescriptionString
TextString.String: Blueberries are a variety of berries characterized by a blue color. It is that simple.

TextString.Name: BrandyDescriptionString
TextString.String: Brandy is a spirit produced using distilled wine.

TextString.Name: BreadDescriptionString
TextString.String: There are thousands varieties of Bread all around the world.

TextString.Name: BreadcrumbsDescriptionString
TextString.String: Old Bread is too stiff to be eaten, better to grind it and use Breadcrumbs in other recipes.

TextString.Name: BroccoliDescriptionString
TextString.String: Eat your greens, especially broccoli. Your parents don't care if you don't like them.

TextString.Name: ButterDescriptionString
TextString.String: Butter is literally a small brick of fat made from milk.

TextString.Name: CabbageDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cabbages are edible plants found in different varieties all across the world.

TextString.Name: CapersDescriptionString
TextString.String: Capers are small fruits with a strong taste originary of the mediterrean.

TextString.Name: CauliflowerDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cauliflowers are like Broccoli on steroids, they can be so massive to be used as cannonballs.

TextString.Name: CarpDescriptionString
TextString.String: Carps are a species of freshwater fishes native to Europe and Asia.

TextString.Name: CarrotDescriptionString
TextString.String: According to the legends, Carrots were originally purple and were made orange by some Dutch growers to honor the Dutch flag.

TextString.Name: CaviarDescriptionString
TextString.String: Caviar is basically a delicacy consisting in salt-cured fish eggs.

TextString.Name: CeleryDescriptionString
TextString.String: Celery is a fibrous stalk cultivated since ancient times.

TextString.Name: CherryDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cherries are small red fruits growing on trees.

TextString.Name: CherryTomatoDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cherry Tomatoes are smaller, sweeter Tomatoes.

TextString.Name: ChestnutsDescriptionString
TextString.String: Chestnuts are edible nuts and not a strange, gross anatomical part of human bodies.

TextString.Name: ChickpeasDescriptionString
TextString.String: Chickpeas are small, round legumes that were once used as a substitute of coffee.

TextString.Name: ChicoryDescriptionString
TextString.String: Chicory is a sour plant whose leaves are used in salads.

TextString.Name: ChiliPepperDescriptionString
TextString.String: Chili Peppers are fruits full of capsaicin, the substance that makes them a dangerous seasoning for weaker palates.

TextString.Name: ChocolateDescriptionString
TextString.String: Chocolate is a food preparation made using cocoa seeds, widely appreciated all around the world.

TextString.Name: DarkChocolateDescriptionString
TextString.String: Dark Chocolate has a stronger cocoa taste.

TextString.Name: WhiteChocolateDescriptionString
TextString.String: Chocolate is a variety of chocolate that can be barely called "chocolate", since it's mostly cocoa butter

TextString.Name: CinnamonDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cinnamon is a spice obtained from the inner bark of a tree. You've been eating grinded bark for your whole life without knowing it.

TextString.Name: ClamsDescriptionString
TextString.String: Clams are bivalve molluscs found in different varieties.

TextString.Name: ClovesDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cloves are aromatic flowers native to the Moluccas in Indonesia.

TextString.Name: CocoaDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cocoa is the fundamental ingredient of Chocolate, the result of grinding dried cacao beans.

TextString.Name: CoconutDescriptionString
TextString.String: Coconut are wooden-armored fruits that, unlike many other fruits, make milk.

TextString.Name: CodDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cod is the name used for several species of very popular fishes.

TextString.Name: CoffeeDescriptionString
TextString.String: Coffee is a drink made using roasted coffee beans, a legalized drug, a panacea for all evils, hangouts, and bad nights of sleep.

TextString.Name: CorianderDescriptionString
TextString.String: Coriander is a Chinese plants whose seeds and leaves are eaten or used as seasoning.

TextString.Name: CornDescriptionString
TextString.String: Corn is a crop native to the Americas, which became the foundation of many diets all around the globe.

TextString.Name: CornstarchDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cornstarch is not only in the world of cooking, but it also has several industrial uses.

TextString.Name: CousCousDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cous Cous is a North African dish of smal steamed wheat fragments.

TextString.Name: CowCheeseDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cow Cheese is made using Cow Milk, if you were really wondering about it now you know it!

TextString.Name: CrabDescriptionString
TextString.String: Did you know that Crabs can main themselves if necessary for their survival? So brutal!

TextString.Name: CrayfishDescriptionString
TextString.String: Crasyfishes are also known as freshwater lobster, meaning that they are probably cheaper than real lobster.

TextString.Name: CreamDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cream is a widely used ingredient made from milk. You lack the knowledge needed to create a tasty sauce? Just add cream!

TextString.Name: CucumberDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cucumbers are widely cultivated across the world, despite them being sticky once cutted.

TextString.Name: CuminDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cumin is a popular spice native to the Middle East and India.

TextString.Name: CurryDescriptionString
TextString.String: Curry is an Indian mix of spices. Spices are so important in India that centuries ago rulers and nobles had their own spice experts creating unique spice mixes.

TextString.Name: CuttlefishDescriptionString
TextString.String: ph'nglui mglw'nafh Cuttlefish r'lyeh wgah'nagl fhtagn

TextString.Name: DatesDescriptionString
TextString.String: Dates are edible sweet fruits harvested from the Date Palm. Woah, I'd never guessed that!

TextString.Name: DouchiDescriptionString
TextString.String: Douchi is a type of fermented salted black soybean made in China.

TextString.Name: DuckDescriptionString
TextString.String: Duck is like tastier chicken with a different meat color.

TextString.Name: EggDescriptionString
TextString.String: Eggs are a versatile ingredients, full of important nutrients and even quite cheap.

TextString.Name: EggplantDescriptionString
TextString.String: Coming in different sizes and colors, Eggplants are a versatile vegetable.

TextString.Name: FavaBeansDescriptionString
TextString.String: Used to vote in ancient times!

TextString.Name: FennelDescriptionString
TextString.String: Fennel is a plant in the Carrot family but it certainly doesn't taste like Carrots.

TextString.Name: FigsDescriptionString
TextString.String: Despite being strangely shaped and colored, Figs are actually really sweet and full of flavor.

TextString.Name: FlourDescriptionString
TextString.String: Flour is an ancient ingredient made of grinded wheat, whose gluten allow people to mix it with water and shape it at will.

TextString.Name: FreshPastaDescriptionString
TextString.String: Fresh Pasta is usually made with eggs instead of water, and has a distinctive yellow-ish color.

TextString.Name: FrogDescriptionString
TextString.String: While not common, Frogs are eaten in some parts of the world.

TextString.Name: GarlicDescriptionString
TextString.String: Despite it being really popular, Garlic is a nightmare for both vampires and kissers.

TextString.Name: GelatineDescriptionString
TextString.String: Used to gelify stuff, most Gelatine is made with pork collagen, but there are several vegan option like the Agar Agar.

TextString.Name: GingerDescriptionString
TextString.String: Ginger isn't only used as spice, but also as a traditional medicine.

TextString.Name: GoatCheeseDescriptionString
TextString.String: Made with Goat Milk, Goat Cheese has a distintive pungent flavor.

TextString.Name: GrapefruitDescriptionString
TextString.String: Grapefruits are hybrid citrus fruits originated in the Barbados.

TextString.Name: GreenOnionDescriptionString
TextString.String: They are pretty much like Onions, but green. Greener is obviously better, isn't it?

TextString.Name: GrouperDescriptionString
TextString.String: While staring at a Grouper for the first time one may wonder: "How hungry were the fishermen that dared to taste its meat?"

TextString.Name: HaddockDescriptionString
TextString.String: Haddock is a saltwater fish very popular ingredients, which may be preserved by smoking.

TextString.Name: HazelnutsDescriptionString
TextString.String: Small and tasty, Hazelnuts are the foundation of one of the most popular sweet creams in the world.

TextString.Name: HoneyDescriptionString
TextString.String: Honey is literally bee vomit, but that never stopped people from eating it.

TextString.Name: JamDescriptionString
TextString.String: Years ago when greenhouses weren't that common people turned fresh fruit into jam to preserve it for a long time.

TextString.Name: KetchupDescriptionString
TextString.String: Ketchup is not really an American condiment; it was already a popular fish-based sauce in the Fujian Province of China in the 17th Century.

TextString.Name: KiwiDescriptionString
TextString.String: Kiwis are both edible berries and flightless birds native to New Zealand.

TextString.Name: LambDescriptionString
TextString.String: Lamb is a traditional ingredient in many countries, other than being referenced several times in many religious books.

TextString.Name: LardDescriptionString
TextString.String: Who needs Oil when you can use Lard to cook?

TextString.Name: LeekDescriptionString
TextString.String: Leeks are quite popular in many countries, their taste is similar to Onions, but milder.

TextString.Name: LemonDescriptionString
TextString.String: Lemons have a wide variety of uses in the world of cooking.

TextString.Name: LentilsDescriptionString
TextString.String: Lentils are small legumes commonly used in many spiced dishes.

TextString.Name: LettuceDescriptionString
TextString.String: Lettuce is a green leaved edible plant mostly used raw in salads.

TextString.Name: LimeDescriptionString
TextString.String: Limes are similar to Lemons, but they do have a more complex aroma.

TextString.Name: LobsterDescriptionString
TextString.String: Lobsters used to be working class food. The MAN ruining everything as usual.

TextString.Name: LotusSeedsDescriptionString
TextString.String: Lotus Seeds are used in Asian cuisine and traditional medicine. They are usually sold dried.

TextString.Name: MangoDescriptionString
TextString.String: Mangoes are tropical fruits, and also the national fruit of Indie, Palkistan and the Philippines.

TextString.Name: MapleSyrupDescriptionString
TextString.String: Maple Syrup is a sweet liquid made by poking holes in tree to steal them their precious sap.

TextString.Name: MascarponeDescriptionString
TextString.String: Mascarpone is an italian cream cheese used in many desserts and known for being a threat to all diets.

TextString.Name: MayonnaiseDescriptionString
TextString.String: Made of Eggs and Oil, Mayonnaise is basically 90% fat. That's why it is so good.

TextString.Name: MediterreanLobsterDescriptionString
TextString.String: Mediterranean Lobster is just like Lobster but manage to cost even more.

TextString.Name: MelonDescriptionString
TextString.String: Melons are big, sweet fruits coming in several varieties from all across the world.

TextString.Name: MilkDescriptionString
TextString.String: While Cow's Milk is the most common Milk in Europe and North America, several different animals are used to produce Milk.

TextString.Name: MintDescriptionString
TextString.String: One of the most common flavors in Western Countries, it can be found in any kind of recipe and in a lot of different kind of industrial-made food.

TextString.Name: MonkfishDescriptionString
TextString.String: Also called Sea Devil because of its beauty, Monkfish has a peculiar meat texture.

TextString.Name: MortadellaDescriptionString
TextString.String: Mortadella is a kind of italian luncheon meat, but similar product can be found all across the world, including the infamous Bologna.

TextString.Name: MozzarellaDescriptionString
TextString.String: Mozzarella is a southern Italian Cheese made from cow or buffalo's Milk

TextString.Name: MulletBottargaDescriptionString
TextString.String: Mullet Bottarga is a salty ingredient made drying fish roe.

TextString.Name: MushroomsDescriptionString
TextString.String: Mushrooms comes in many varieties and are spread all across the world.

TextString.Name: MusselsDescriptionString
TextString.String: Mussels are bivalve molluscs with a black shell.

TextString.Name: MustardDescriptionString
TextString.String: Mustard is a condiment made using the seeds of a mustard plant.

TextString.Name: MuttonDescriptionString
TextString.String: Mutton meat has a stronger flavor than Lamb and for this reason is not as much popular.

TextString.Name: NapaCabbageDescriptionString
TextString.String: Napa Cabbage is a tipically chinese leaf vegetable, that is becoming popular in the rest of the world

TextString.Name: NoodlesDescriptionString
TextString.String: While generic Noodles are popular all across the world, this ingredient refers to the eastern ones! So very precise!

TextString.Name: NutmegDescriptionString
TextString.String: Nutmeg is not only a spice, it also has psychoactive effects. Bad ones.

TextString.Name: OatsDescriptionString
TextString.String: While being used as ingredients in some cases, most of the Oats produced is meant to be livestock food.

TextString.Name: OctopusDescriptionString
TextString.String: When not busy in Japan's entertainment industry, Octopuses are used in cooking.

TextString.Name: OliveOilDescriptionString
TextString.String: Olive Oil is a known for its unique flavor and its high price.

TextString.Name: OlivesDescriptionString
TextString.String: Olives are very good, but it is really tiresome to remove the seed from each one of them while preparing a meal.

TextString.Name: OnionDescriptionString
TextString.String: Onion is pretty much organic tear gas, with limited effects but also limited cost.

TextString.Name: OrangeDescriptionString
TextString.String: While most Oranges in the world are probably squeezed for their juice, some of them actually get in the hands of cooks.

TextString.Name: OreganoDescriptionString
TextString.String: Oregano is a plant in the mint family which leaves are used as spice, due to their unique and strong flavor.

TextString.Name: OystersDescriptionString
TextString.String: A raw oyster is likely to be still alive when you eat it. Cruel. And Yummy!

TextString.Name: PapayaDescriptionString
TextString.String: Papaya fruits slowly became popular in the world, with India being the lead producer of them.

TextString.Name: PaprikaDescriptionString
TextString.String: Paprika is a spice made using dried Bell Peppers or Sweet Peppers.

TextString.Name: ParmesanDescriptionString
TextString.String: Parmesan is the most famous, and most counterfeit, Italian cheese.

TextString.Name: ParsleyDescriptionString
TextString.String: Some people says that Parsley is good on anything, but you better not try that in this game.

TextString.Name: PassionFruitDescriptionString
TextString.String: Many people think the name "Passion Fruit" refers to earthly love, it doesn't actually help you with that.

TextString.Name: PastaDescriptionString
TextString.String: Pasta is very popular and, despite the Italians claiming it to be an invention of theirs, there are several kinds of pasta scattered around the world.

TextString.Name: PeachDescriptionString
TextString.String: Peach, in this case, refers to the fruit, not the princess.

TextString.Name: PeanutsDescriptionString
TextString.String: Peanuts aren't nuts, they are legumes. But "Pealegumes" would be slightly more confusing, to be honest.

TextString.Name: PearDescriptionString
TextString.String: Pear is a peculiarly shaped fruit coming in many varieties.

TextString.Name: PeppersDescriptionString
TextString.String: Bell Peppers come in all kinds of colours: red,green, yellow, white, purple.

TextString.Name: PicklesDescriptionString
TextString.String: You'll find them in every sandwich you eat. Especially if you hate them.

TextString.Name: PigeonDescriptionString
TextString.String: Pigeon is a peculiar taste of the Middle Age. Still valid in our times, though.

TextString.Name: PikePerchDescriptionString
TextString.String: A freshwater found in Europe and North America.

TextString.Name: PineappleDescriptionString
TextString.String: I have a pen, I have pineapple...

TextString.Name: PineNutsDescriptionString
TextString.String: Pine Nuts comes from Pine Cone that comes from Pine Trees. Pine!

TextString.Name: PlumDescriptionString
TextString.String: In the late 18th century, the word, plum, was used to indicate "something desirable".

TextString.Name: JiaoziDescriptionString
TextString.String: Chinese dumplings, filled with meat or vegetables.

TextString.Name: PorkDescriptionString
TextString.String: The most commonly consumed meat worldwide. The source of all ham and bacon!

TextString.Name: PotatoDescriptionString
TextString.String: Tubers that are alone responsible for a quarter of the growth in Old World population and urbanization between 1700 and 1900

TextString.Name: PrawnsDescriptionString
TextString.String: A good source of protein. One of the tastier!

TextString.Name: HamDescriptionString
TextString.String: Pork meat cured by salting and sometimes smoking, with different spices as black pepper or saffron.

TextString.Name: QuailDescriptionString
TextString.String: While a quail doesn't offer much to eat, every tiny bite can be delicious if properly cooked.

TextString.Name: RabbitDescriptionString
TextString.String: Some people says rabbit's meat tastes like cat one. Are those people part of a secret sect of domestic pet eaters?

TextString.Name: RaisinsDescriptionString
TextString.String: Dried grapes. You either love them or hate them.

TextString.Name: RaspberryDescriptionString
TextString.String: It derives its name from raspise, "a sweet rose-colored wine".

TextString.Name: RedGurnardDescriptionString
TextString.String: A fish widespread in the Eastern Atlantic.

TextString.Name: RedWineDescriptionString
TextString.String: Wine made with black grape varieties.

TextString.Name: RiceDescriptionString
TextString.String: Unlike what one may think, rice is not appreciated only in Asia.

TextString.Name: RicottaDescriptionString
TextString.String: An Italian whey cheese, whose production dates back to the Bronze Age.

TextString.Name: RocketSaladDescriptionString
TextString.String: Slightly bitter, mentioned by various classical authors as an aphrodisiac.

TextString.Name: RosemaryDescriptionString
TextString.String: Aromatic evergreen shrub. Good with potatoes!

TextString.Name: RumDescriptionString
TextString.String: Distilled alcoholic drink made from sugarcane by fermentation and distillation.

TextString.Name: SaffronDescriptionString
TextString.String: Spice derived from a flower whose stigmas are collected hand-made and dried. That's why it costs so much.

TextString.Name: SageDescriptionString
TextString.String: Sage is native to the Mediterranean region and is used fresh or dried as a flavoring in many foods.

TextString.Name: SakeDescriptionString
TextString.String: Famous japanese alcoholic beverage made by fermenting rice.

TextString.Name: SalmonDescriptionString
TextString.String: Sashimi, Salmon burger, Tartare... There is nothing you can't do with Salmon.

TextString.Name: SauerkrautDescriptionString
TextString.String: Fermented cabbage useful to identify the German host in your table.

TextString.Name: SausageDescriptionString
TextString.String: Along with the banana, the most used food to make sex jokes.

TextString.Name: SeaBreamDescriptionString
TextString.String: An auspicious food often served at New Year's and festive occasions in Japan.

TextString.Name: SeasonedSheepCheeseDescriptiveNameString
TextString.String: You don't put only wine in the cellar.

TextString.Name: SeasonedSheepCheeseDescriptionString
TextString.String: Every year make it tastier. If you don't mind the... flavour.

TextString.Name: SeedsOilDescriptionString
TextString.String: Oil extracted by seeds of some plants.

TextString.Name: SesameOilDescriptionString
TextString.String: Vegetable oil extracted by sesame seeds.

TextString.Name: ShallotDescriptionString
TextString.String: It looks like an onion, but it has a milder flavour.

TextString.Name: ShaoxingWineDescriptionString
TextString.String: Chinese alcoholic beverage made by fermenting rice.

TextString.Name: SichuanPeppercornDescriptionString
TextString.String: A spice commonly used in the Chinese cuisine that creates a sense of numbness in the mouth.

TextString.Name: SoleDescriptionString
TextString.String: One of the most famous flat fish!

TextString.Name: SoyDescriptionString
TextString.String: The basic ingredient of vegan diets.

TextString.Name: SoyMilkDescriptionString
TextString.String: A byproduct of tofu production, it may be used as a substitute for dairy milk.

TextString.Name: SoySauceDescriptionString
TextString.String: A condiment made from a fermented paste of soybeans.

TextString.Name: SoybeanPasteDescriptionString
TextString.String: Fermented paste made from ground soybeans.

TextString.Name: SpicySalamiDescriptionString
TextString.String: Cured spicy sausage with pork meat.

TextString.Name: SpinachDescriptionString
TextString.String: Popeye's favorite food. He deceived us all these years.

TextString.Name: SquidDescriptionString
TextString.String: The most juicy escaping mechanism in nature.

TextString.Name: StockDescriptionString
TextString.String: The basis of many dishes, particularly soups and sauces. Made with meat.

TextString.Name: StrawberryDescriptionString
TextString.String: Red and sweet fruit widely used in the pastry-making.

TextString.Name: SugarDescriptionString
TextString.String: Sweet-tasting, soluble carbohydrates. Yes, that's actually its scientific definition.

TextString.Name: SwordfishDescriptionString
TextString.String: You don't want to have an encounter with this fish that its not on your table.

TextString.Name: ThymeDescriptionString
TextString.String: Aromatic perennial evergreen herb with culinary, medicinal, and ornamental uses.

TextString.Name: TomatoDescriptionString
TextString.String: The main reason why the European colonization of the Americas is such an important historical event.

TextString.Name: TomatoPureeDescriptionString
TextString.String: Puree made by cooking and straining tomatoes.

TextString.Name: TroutDescriptionString
TextString.String: Fish that lives in freshwater lakes and rivers only.

TextString.Name: TunaDescriptionString
TextString.String: Gigantic saltwater fish. And the main aliment for young people who study abroad.

TextString.Name: TurkeyDescriptionString
TextString.String: The country that was more liberal 100 years ago than now. Wait, what?

TextString.Name: TurmericDescriptionString
TextString.String: It imparts a mustard-like, earthy aroma and pungent, slightly bitter flavor to foods.

TextString.Name: VanillaDescriptionString
TextString.String: Along with the introduction of chocolate in Europe, the only good action of Hernan Cortes.

TextString.Name: VegetableStockDescriptionString
TextString.String: The basis of many dishes, particularly soups and sauces. Made without meat.

TextString.Name: VinegarDescriptionString
TextString.String: The result of your failed experiments with wine.

TextString.Name: WalnutsDescriptionString
TextString.String: One of the most caloric ingredient in the world.

TextString.Name: WhiteTruffleDescriptionString
TextString.String: Found mainly in the Piedmont region in northern Italy. You have to work 10 years to buy one of these.

TextString.Name: WhiteWineDescriptionString
TextString.String: Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, Pinot Gris, white wine comes in a variety of tastes.

TextString.Name: WorcestershireSauceDescriptionString
TextString.String: A really complex mixture of vinegar, molasses, sugar, anchovies...

TextString.Name: YogurtDescriptionString
TextString.String: Produced by the bacterial fermentation of milk, yogurt is rich in protein and vitamins.

TextString.Name: ZucchiniDescriptionString
TextString.String: What is long, green and hard? No, it's not Hulk's maypole, you monster.

TextString.Name: PistachioDescriptionString
TextString.String: A plant that grows in rugged terrains. It's harvested every second year.

TextString.Name: SourCreamDescriptionString
TextString.String: Its name comes from the production of lactic acid by bacterial fermentation, which is called souring.

TextString.Name: TofuDescriptionString
TextString.String: Aliment prepared by coagulating soy milk and pressing it into blocks.

TextString.Name: WaterDescriptionString
TextString.String: Simple water, commonly used in many recipes but basically useless in this game.

TextString.Name: MargarineDescriptionString
TextString.String: Margarine was originally created in France as a cheap butter substitute for armed forces and lower classes.
